column4: jbarbero-> also try  sudo lshw -C network and see if the driver is loaded okay
lshw -C network prints info about the Cisco card
jbarbero-> same command, look at the results carefully
there is no 'configuration:' entry (the configuration entry for eth0 has the word 'driver' in it)
jbarbero-> can you paste in pastebin the results of your sudo lshw -C network
jbarbero-> you dont have the driver for your cisco 340 loaded
right, and how would I got about loading it? I guess it's not automatic
jbarbero-> i guess first thing is find out which chip that card uses and load it, or maybe use ndiswrapper?
I'll look into it and come back if I'm stuck
I found a thread with the info! http://ubuntu-utah.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=409247 thanks, I found it after searching with lshw network in my search terms
it's all fixed, it was an obscure bug but easy to fix
cool..just curious what was the lil bug about?
sorry, I had had to go. The bug was a conflict between an AES-related kernel module and the airo kernel module. Blocking the module and rebooting fixed it.
